alert.note: Alert for Union (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 7:03PM EDT until June 28 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Jersey, including the following counties, western Essex and western Union. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 703 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, capable of causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 3/4 and 1 1/4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1/4 to 1/2 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Plainfield, Summit, Millburn, Westfield, Livingston, Scotch Plains, Berkeley Heights, New Providence, Fanwood, Mountainside, Roseland and Springfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
